title: Multiple Check
description:
Multiple Check

Given two integers x and y, return true if x is a multiple of y, otherwise return false.

Examples:

  • Input: x = 15, y = 3
    Output: true
    Explanation: 15 = 3 Ã— 5
  • Input: x = 10, y = 3
    Output: false

Constraints:

  • Handle edge cases with zero values
  • Standard integer range
solution_text:
Multiple Check

Algorithm:

  1. Use modulo operator to check if remainder is 0
  2. Handle edge case where y is 0

Time Complexity: O(1) - constant time

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant space

Key Insights:

  • x is a multiple of y if x % y == 0
  • Need to handle division by zero
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the boolean result"""
    def bool_to_string(val):
        return 'true' if val else 'false'
    
    # Convert expected output string to boolean for comparison
    expected_bool = expected_output == 'true' if isinstance(expected_output, str) else expected_output
    
    passed = actual_output == expected_bool
    output_str = bool_to_string(actual_output)
    
    return [passed, output_str]
